overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a structured approach to time-series forecasting focused on short history (96 hourly points) with clear seasonality. It emphasizes handling data limitations through robust methods, considering multiple modeling options before selecting a simple averaging technique. The analysis shows careful pattern recognition, manual computation of hourly averages, and attention to output formatting requirements.
common_data_patterns: Negative value dominance in afternoon/evening hours
Increasing negative extremes in later days
key_insights: Prioritizing simplicity for short time-series data (4 days)
Using multi-day hourly averaging to smooth seasonal patterns
Manual pattern analysis through day/hour matrix decomposition
Consistent rounding and formatting to match input data specifications
Explicit consideration of data limitations (e.g., insufficient history for weekly seasonality)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed pattern examination and manual calculations, though ultimately employing a simple averaging method due to data constraints.
